thread.title: World's longest commercial flight lands in New Zealand
thread.title_full: World's longest commercial flight lands in New Zealand

author: Tom Powell
title: World's longest commercial flight lands in New Zealand
text:
Monday 6 February 2017 09:06 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Arrival: The plane was welcomed in the traditional way, with a showering from water cannons Qatar Airways 
The world’s longest commercial flight has landed in New Zealand having taken off almost more than 9,000 miles away in Qatar . 
Qatar Airways’ non-stop service from Doha to Auckland landed at 7.25am (6.25pm GMT on Sunday) after spending 16 hours and 23 minutes in the air. 
“We’ve officially landed in Auckland,” tweeted the airline as its long-range Boeing 777-200LR made aviation history. 
With four pilots on board taking shifts, the plane passed through 10 time zones on its 9,032-mile journey. We’ve officially landed in New Zealand, the ‘Land of the Long White Cloud.’ Kia ora! #AucklandTogether pic.twitter.com/d0BNsWRU9f — Qatar Airways (@qatarairways) February 5, 2017 
The 15 members of crew served 1,100 cups of tea and coffee, 2,000 cold drinks and over 1,000 meals on the flight. 
The airline noted that the journey time was long enough to watch either the entire Lord of the Rings or The Hobbit trilogy. 
As is tradition for inaugural flights, the plane was welcomed with a showering from water cannons. Journey: the 9,032-mile service will now run daily (Qatar Airways) 
Qatar Airways Group Chief Executive, Mr Akbar Al Baker, who travelled on board the inaugural flight, said: “Arriving in Auckland on Waitangi Day, and achieving the title of world’s longest flight for the return record-breaking service, which covers a distance of 14,535 kilometres and lasts 17 hours and 30 minutes, makes this an even more momentous occasion for Qatar Airways and provides another accomplishment to celebrate in this our 20th year flying the flag internationally for Qatar.” Read more
